p: Another possible pathological modification induced by the CoV in susceptible patients is the activation of alternatively activated macrophages, M2, which normally have anti-inflammatory actions and are involved in the wound-healing processes ( 82), but were also found in the lungs of mice lacking STAT1 signaling pathway ( STAT1 knockouts), which after the SARS-CoV infection, had an increased number of M2 macrophages in their lungs, activated via the STAT6 pathway, and developed pulmonary fibrosis ( 83).
